info.title: Rewards APIs
info.description:
# Overview
Rewards APIs provide functionalities to retrieve rewards balances, redeemed rewards and rebates including historical information. Rewards Identifier can either be Programme or Card account number. These APIs also provides functionalities to view Rewards Catalogue items and redeem Rewards as miles, Vouchers, Cashback for your earned Rewards points.

# Version History
Version | Release date | Change Log
--------|--------------|----------------------
1.0      | October, 2017   | Base version of API
1.0      | July, 2018   | Added new API **Retrieve Rewards Summary**. Added new fields **grossAmount** and **merchantId** to **Pay merchant using Rewards points** and **Pay merchant using daily$** API.  Added new field **uuid** for all APIs.

# Authentication
<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

# Pagination
Pagination is not available on this API.

# Frequently Asked Question
Q1: How to get list of Active Rewards account?

Ans: Get list of Active rewards account using **/parties/{partyId}/rewards** with path parameters PartyId

Q2:  How to return rewards rebate transaction history?

Ans: Get rewards rebate transaction history for a given rewards identifier using **/rewards/{rewardsId}/rebatesTransactions** with path parameters rewardsId. Note: Start date and End Date is mandatory.

Q3: How to redeem Rewards as Miles, Vouchers, or Cashback?

Ans: Get the redemption of Rewards to get Miles or Loyalty points, Vouchers or Cashback using **/rewards/milesConversion/rewards/vouchersRedemption** , **/rewards/rebatesCashback**

Q4: How to invoke partial redemption for Rewards?

Ans: Enter the total amount of the transaction in the grossAmount field and the amount to be redeemed via rewards in the redeemAmount field when calling the **/rewards/{rewardsId}/paymentByPoints** or **/rewards/{rewardsId}/paymentByRebates**.

# Known Issues
This API has no pending issues at the moment. Want to report a new issue? please help us **here**

# Throttling (Rate Limits)
We throttle our APIs by default to ensure maximum performance for all developers.

accessToken.description: For accessing the API, a valid JWT token must be passed as part of the headers. You can obtain one through the authorization steps. Please go through the "How it Works" section for more details.

get.description:
Return a list of the active rewards accounts with the rewards for a given party identifier.

*Important*: The table below describes the changes in the API behaviour according to the value of the 'accept-version' passed in the request header. Setting a specific version is recommended to invoke the desired message-set, unless the most recent version is required.
accept-version | Release date | Change Log
--------|--------------|----------------------
1.0      | October, 2017   | Base version of API
1.1      | July, 2018   | Added new field **uuid** in request body

parameters.name: accept-version
parameters.description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

200.description: List of rewards accounts are returned

get.summary: Check if balance is sufficient for the bill amount
get.description:
This API can be used to in two ways - One is to check the available Rewards balance and the other is to check if the bill amount can be covered with the available Rewards balance. In the second case, if the balance is less than the bill amount, then available Cash value equivalent of Rewards balance is returned.

*Important*: The table below describes the changes in the API behaviour according to the value of the 'accept-version' passed in the request header. Setting a specific version is recommended to invoke the desired message-set, unless the most recent version is required.
accept-version | Release date | Change Log
--------|--------------|----------------------
1.0      | October, 2017   | Base version of API
1.1      | July, 2018   |Added new field **uuid** in request body

parameters.name: accept-version
parameters.description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Bill amount for which Rewards balance has to be checked for sufficiency

200.description: Rewards balance checked against the provided bill/redemption amount.

get.description:
Returns the conversion rates to redeem customer's' Points or Rebates for the Merchant's products/services. The rates could optionally vary based on the Merchant as well (currently not in scope).

*Important*: The table below describes the changes in the API behaviour according to the value of the 'accept-version' passed in the request header. Setting a specific version is recommended to invoke the desired message-set, unless the most recent version is required.
accept-version | Release date | Change Log
--------|--------------|----------------------
1.0      | October, 2017   | Base version of API
1.1      | July, 2018   |Added new field **uuid** in request body

parameters.name: accept-version
parameters.description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

post.description:
Initiates the redemption of Points for payments to a Merchant partner. The referenceId and orderId must be unique for each request. However, if invoking this API more than once because of error in previous attempt, then orderId can be same but referenceId must be (different and) unique.

*Important*: The table below describes the changes in the API behaviour according to the value of the *'accept-version'* passed in the request header. Setting a specific version is recommended to invoke the desired message-set, unless the most recent version is required.
accept-version | Release date | Change Log
--------|--------------|----------------------
1.0      | October, 2017   | Base version of API
1.1      | July, 2018   | Added new fields **grossAmount**, **merchantId** and **uuid** in request body

parameters.name: accept-version
parameters.description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

post.description:
Initiates the redemption of Daily$ for payments to a Merchant partner. The referenceId and orderId must be unique for each request. However, if invoking this API more than once because of error in previous attempt, then orderId can be same but referenceId must be (different and) unique.

*Important*: The table below describes the changes in the API behaviour according to the value of the 'accept-version' passed in the request header. Setting a specific version is recommended to invoke the desired message-set, unless the most recent version is required.

post.description:
Initiates reversal of rewards redemptions. This is applicable to a successful redemption transaction with DBS points or Daily$. This can be used for refund of service or voiding a transaction. 

*Important*: The table below describes the changes in the API behaviour according to the value of the 'accept-version' passed in the request header. Setting a specific version is recommended to invoke the desired message-set, unless the most recent version is required.

parameters.name: accept-version
parameters.description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

get.description:
Returns a list of rewards accounts with the available rewards balance for a given party identifier and its corresponding conversion rate. If amount is specified, it checks whether the rewards balances is sufficient for the bill amount. Otherwise, it shows the minimum and total redeemable amounts of the rewards accounts. 

*Important*: The table below describes the changes in the API behaviour according to the value of the 'accept-version' passed in the request header. Setting a specific version is recommended to invoke the desired message-set, unless the most recent version is required.

parameters.name: accept-version
parameters.description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Bill amount for which Rewards balance has to be checked for sufficiency

parameters.name: merchantId
parameters.description: Identifier for the merchant involved in the transaction

200.description: Summary of rewards accounts are returned

cardDescription.description: Card Description.  Eg. DBS Black Card, POSB Everyday Card

schemeName.description: Scheme Name. Eg. DAILY$, SAFRA$, DBS Points

rewardsScheme.description: Rewards Scheme Type.  Eg. 'CR': Cash Rebates, 'BPT': Bonus Points

schemeName.description: Scheme Name. Eg. DAILY$, SAFRA$, DBS Points

rewardsScheme.description: Rewards Scheme Type.  Eg. 'CR': Cash Rebates, 'BPT': Bonus Points

previousPoints.description: Points earned as of last statement

adjustedInPoints.description: Adjusted in points since last statement

adjustedOutPoints.description: Adjusted out points since last statement

schemeName.description: Scheme Name. Eg. DAILY$, SAFRA$, DBS Points

rewardsScheme.description: Rewards Scheme Type.  Eg. 'CR': Cash Rebates, 'BPT': Bonus Points

earnedValue.description: Rebates value earned since last statement

redeemedValue.description: Rebates value redeemed since last statement

adjustedInValue.description: Adjusted in value since last statement

adjustedOutValue.description: Adjusted out value since last statement

expiredValue.description: Rebates value that have expired since last statement

postingDate.description: Date Transaction was posted on system

transactionTypeDescription.description: Transaction Type Description.  Eg. Award, Refund, Redeem, Adjust

additionalReference.description: Additional reference of the Transaction. Eg. Frequent Flyer Programme ID, CASA Account Number where rewards is credited

postingDate.description: Date Transaction was posted on system

transactionTypeDescription.description: Transaction Type Description.  Eg. Award, Refund, Redeem, Adjust

additionalReference.description: Additional reference of the Transaction. Eg. Frequent Flyer Programme ID, CASA Account Number where rewards is credited

orderId.description: Redemption Order reference number for redemption request

schemeId.description: Reward Scheme Identifier. Ex: Daily$, DBS Points, Air Miles etc.

orderId.description: Redemption Order reference number for redemption request

redeemQuantity.description: Quantity of items to be redeemed

price.description: Price of the Reward Item. The price value can be Points or Amount

faceValue.description: Actual value of the Reward item

additionalPayment.description: Additional cash payment needed to redeem

outletName.description: Name of the outlet to redeem the reward item

schemeId.description: Reward Scheme Identifier. Ex: Daily$, DBS Points, Air Miles etc.

redeemQuantity.description: Quantity of items to be redeemed

membershipDetl.description: Reward redemption to a Membership program account
Membership program details to redeem Reward

partyName.description: Name as per the Membership program

orderId.description: Redemption Order reference number for redemption request

schemeId.description: Reward Scheme Identifier. Ex: Daily$, DBS Points, Air Miles etc.

isCollatable.description: Indicates whether the redemption items can be collated together into one reward item. Ex: 3 vouchers of $10 each can be redeemed as one $30 voucher

balanceCheck.description: Results of balance check before redemption request

requestedAmount.description: Amount for which validation was requested on the Rewards balance.

isSufficient.description: Indicates whether or not the balance is sufficient to cover the requested Amount.

minimumRedeemableAmount.description: Minimum Amount that can be redeemed for the Rewards scheme. This will be populated only when balance is not zero.

totalRedeemableAmount.description: Total cash value balance that can be redeemed. This will be populated only when balance is insufficient to cover the requested amount.

totalRedeemablePoints.description: Total DBS Points balance that can be redeemed. This will be populated only when balance is insufficient to cover the requested amount.

conversionRates.description: Conversion rates from Points to Cash value

units.description: Units of currency. This is the base value for conversion

pointsPerUnit.description: Points needs per unit value of the currency

referenceId.description: Transaction Reference identifier for payment of remaining bill amount.

paymentByPoints.description: Results of payment with Reward points

referenceId.description: Transaction Reference identifier for payment of remaining bill amount.

merchantId.description: Identifier for the merchant involved in the transaction.

referenceId.description: Transaction Reference identifier for payment request using Points.

grossAmount.description: Total bill amount of the transaction

reversalRequest.description: Details of redemption reversal of Rewards points and Daily$

merchantId.description: Identifier for the merchant involved in the transaction.

reversalReferenceId.description: Reference identifier for the redemption reversal request

redemptionReferenceId.description: Order reference identifier of the original redemption transaction

transactionDateTime.description: Timestamp of the original redemption transaction

grossAmount.description: Total bill amount of the transaction

reversalResponse.description: Results of redemption reversal of Reward points and Daily$

reversalReferenceId.description: Reference identifier for the redemption reversal.

rewardsBalance.description: Redeemable amount after reversal, breakdown by account level

remainingCashValue.description: Cash value of the points or rebates remaining

requestedAmount.description: Amount for which validation was requested on the Rewards balance.

isSufficient.description: Indicates whether or not the points balance is sufficient to cover the requested Amount. This will be populated if query amount is present.

minimumRedeemableAmount.description: Minimum Amount that can be redeemed for Points scheme. This will be populated if query amount is not present or exceeds the balance.

totalRedeemableAmount.description: Total cash value amount equivalent that can be redeemed for Points scheme. This will be populated if query amount is not present or exceeds the balance.

totalRedeemablePoints.description: Total number of points that can be redeemed.

rebatesBalancesSummary.description: Summary of Rebates balances( Only Daily$ is supported for now)

isSufficient.description: Indicates whether or not the Rebates balance is sufficient to cover the requested Amount. This will be populated if query amount is present.

minimumRedeemableAmount.description: Minimum Amount that can be redeemed for Rebates scheme. This will be populated if query amount is not present or exceeds the balance.

totalRedeemableAmount.description: Total cash value amount equivalent that can be redeemed for Rebates scheme. This will be populated if query amount is not present or exceeds the balance.

totalRedeemableRebates.description: Total value of Rebates that can be redeemed

cardDescription.description: Card Description.  Eg. DBS Black Card, POSB Everyday Card

schemeName.description: Scheme Name. Eg. DAILY$, SAFRA$, DBS Points

rewardsScheme.description: Rewards Scheme Type.  Eg. 'CR': Cash Rebates, 'BPT': Bonus Points

conversionRates.description: Conversion rate for rewards scheme. Only available for Rewards points.

units.description: Units of currency. This is the base value for conversion

pointsPerUnit.description: Points needed per unit value of the currency
